struct __pyx_opt_args_9histogram__spatial {

 037:      int npatterns=59, int overlapX=2, int overlapY=2):
 038: 	"""
 039: 	> Implementation of Ahonen's Enhanced Spatial Histogram, with overlaps.
 040: 	> The window size couldn't be fixed. Example, if there are 2 noses 
 041: 	  pictures of the same dog, the first 800x800 and the second 400x400,
 042: 	  then the spatial information will not match.
 043: 	> More or less realistic assumption; the noses pictures will keep ratio.
 044: 	> x and y will mean for vertical and horizontal directions respectively,
 045: 	  (x->rows direction and y->columns direction)
 046: 	> nx and ny stands for the number of divisions in vertical and horizontal	
 047: 	  axis, respectively.
 048: 	"""
 049: 
 050: 	cdef:
+051: 		int height = src.shape[0]
  __pyx_v_height = (__pyx_v_src.shape[0]);

+052: 		int width = src.shape[1]
  __pyx_v_width = (__pyx_v_src.shape[1]);

 053: 
 054: 		#widows size: (wsx,wsy)
+055: 		int wsx = (height+(nx-1)*overlapX)/nx
  __pyx_v_wsx = ((__pyx_v_height + ((__pyx_v_nx - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapX)) / __pyx_v_nx);

+056: 		int wsy = (width+(ny-1)*overlapY)/ny
  __pyx_v_wsy = ((__pyx_v_width + ((__pyx_v_ny - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapY)) / __pyx_v_ny);

 057: 
 058: 		#remainders=(xrem,yrem), ie, number of pixels that 
 059: 		#can't be covered with such windows sizes
+060: 		int xrem = height-nx*wsx+(nx-1)*overlapX
  __pyx_v_xrem = ((__pyx_v_height - (__pyx_v_nx * __pyx_v_wsx)) + ((__pyx_v_nx - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapX));

+061: 		int yrem = width-ny*wsy+(ny-1)*overlapY
  __pyx_v_yrem = ((__pyx_v_width - (__pyx_v_ny * __pyx_v_wsy)) + ((__pyx_v_ny - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapY));

 062: 	"""
 063: 	> Each image subdivision will be named region. there are in
 064: 	  total nx*ny regions.
 065: 	> Each region has two index Rxy=R[x,y].
 066: 	> All regions R[0:rx0,:] and R[rx1:,:] will have a windows 
 067: 	  size with one more pixel on x direction. 
 068: 	> All regions R[:,0:ry0] and R[:,ry1:] will have a windows
 069: 	  size with one more pixel on y direction.
 070: 	"""
 071: 	cdef int rx0, rx1, ry0, ry1
 072: 
+073: 	if xrem%2==0:
  __pyx_t_1 = (((__pyx_v_xrem % 2) == 0) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {

+074: 		rx0 = xrem/2-1
    __pyx_v_rx0 = ((__pyx_v_xrem / 2) - 1);

+075: 		rx1 = nx-xrem/2
    __pyx_v_rx1 = (__pyx_v_nx - (__pyx_v_xrem / 2));
    goto __pyx_L3;
  }
  /*else*/ {

 076: 	else:
+077: 		rx0 = xrem/2
    __pyx_v_rx0 = (__pyx_v_xrem / 2);

+078: 		rx1 = nx-xrem/2
    __pyx_v_rx1 = (__pyx_v_nx - (__pyx_v_xrem / 2));
  }
  __pyx_L3:;

+079: 	if yrem%2==0:
  __pyx_t_1 = (((__pyx_v_yrem % 2) == 0) != 0);

+080: 		ry0 = yrem/2-1

+081: 		ry1 = ny-yrem/2
    __pyx_v_ry1 = (__pyx_v_ny - (__pyx_v_yrem / 2));
    goto __pyx_L4;
  }
  /*else*/ {

 082: 	else:
+083: 		ry0 = yrem/2

+084: 		ry1 = ny-yrem/2
    __pyx_v_ry1 = (__pyx_v_ny - (__pyx_v_yrem / 2));
  }
  __pyx_L4:;
